channel.title: How may I add Gameframes?
channel.description:
Hey guys!
I'm sort of new to the whole Private Server thing, so yeah, I admit, I am a noob. (: Anyways, I was wondering how I add a Gameframe. Say if somebody where to post up their Gameframe, for others to use, and I right clicked and saved the image (I think that's what you do, right?) what do I do then?
Is that even what I'm supposed to do? I'm really looking for help, since I want to create a brand new Client and release on MoparScape for all to use.
Thanks in advanced.

item.title: How may I add Gameframes?
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“Chosen Pkz, post:2, topic:323873”]Its called a jframe, and you gotta write your own.
Jframe are most common on bluur’s clients. You can find menubars etc in the GUI.java, thats where all the jframe stuff is.
You’ll also need a theme.

but its not beginner stuff takes some work for sure. goodluck.[/quote]

Rofl! A JFrame is the Frame on a client, like it says “File” then under it it says “Change IP”, “Change Port” and other stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: How may I add Gameframes?
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Oh, cheers man! Thanks for the info.

I’ll go download it now.
EDIT:
Downloaded, it’s great. Just getting used to it at the moment. Thanks for letting me know on this setuff.
FINISHED EDIT
Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: How may I add Gameframes?
item.dc:creator: @DeltaLegitz DeltaLegitz
item.description:
@DeltaLegitz wrote:

[quote=“Chosen Pkz, post:2, topic:323873”]Its called a jframe, and you gotta write your own.
Jframe are most common on bluur’s clients. You can find menubars etc in the GUI.java, thats where all the jframe stuff is.
You’ll also need a theme.

but its not beginner stuff takes some work for sure. goodluck.[/quote]

Wow your stupid… You really don’t know what he meant… Your amazing… A J-frame is different then the gameframe…

@Ace, You can add the Gameframe in the Sprites folder or by editing the cache with Tom’s cache suite.

Read full topic

Oh, okay!

Thanks man, at least now I know what is needed.
I might look into it sometime, “J-frame”.

Cheers.
